code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:49 yr old white female airman complains of mild fever and mild cough. NKDA. o:Height 161 cm, Weight 94.7 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 114, DiastolicBP 76, Respiration 16, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry.

s:pt presents with mild flatulence for about 3 weeks. pt is a 50 yr old white F. she denies smoking denies any alcohol use o:Height 160 cm, Weight 92.5 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 15, all lung fields, Abdomen = mild tenderness to deep palpitation, HEENT: WNL, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Severe Indigestion p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed NEXIUM - 40 mg daily, and ordered Urea breath test.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

td.content: s:51 yr old f presents with mild fever and mild cough. o:Height 160 cm, Weight 92.3 kg, Temperature 36.9 C, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry.
